result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandy R Terry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Great Harm, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Extended Supervision and Probation conditions same

miscConds.notes: Court waived court costs, assessments and fees, except for mandatory surcharges, in this action during period of probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment. Pay supervision fees.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor.
No violent contact with her children.

Be supervised by the mental health unit, mental health assessment and comply with all recommended treatment.
Complete a parenting class.
Absolute sobriety--no illegal drugs or alcohol.
Random urine screens.
Comply with all CHIPS and MBCW orders.
Have adequate supervision of the children at all times.
Cooperate fully with probation agent.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.
Defendant ordered to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge during probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
AODA assessment and comply with treatment

timeConds.notes: STAYED, until next court date of 10-24-14

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandy R Terry

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandy R Terry in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Sarra M. Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Brandy R Terry in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements made as to sentencing.
The Court sentenced defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT OF 5 YEARS, with credit for 3 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  
.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program; is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
.
Court IMPOSED BUT STAYED the Sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 3 years with the following conditions:
-Defendant to serve 60 days  in the House of Correction, STAYED, until next court date.
-Be supervised by the mental health unit, mental health assessment and comply with all recommended treatment.
-Complete a parenting class.
-AODA assessment and comply with treatment.
-Absolute sobriety-no illegal drugs or alcohol.
-Random urine screens.
-No Violent Contact with her children.
-Comply with all CHIPS and MBCW orders.
-Have adequate supervision of the children at all tiems.
-Cooperate fully with probation agent.
-Maintain full time employment.
-Court waived court costs, assessments and fees, except for mandatory surcharges, in this action during period of Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
-Pay supervision fees.
.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor.
.
Defendant ordered to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge during Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brandy R Terry in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for sentencing.  State would like an adjournment as they have some witnesses that could not appear on this date.  Court granted the request.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandy R Terry in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandy R Terry in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Molly Marie Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held off the record.  Case remains set for jury trial on 4/28/14 in Branch 40.  State withdrew their offer to the defendant.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.

Defendant Brandy R Terry in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Scheduling Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING/ARRAIGNMENT commencing 02/03/2014 received and filed. (27 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Attorney Calvin Malone, 819 N. 6th Street, 9th  Floor, Milwaukee, WI  53203.

Defendant Brandy R Terry in court with attorney Mary Scholle for Calvin R Malone.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Police Officer Danilo Cardenas.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with B.M., (9/28/12), E.M., (5/7/10), OR D.M. (7/22/07), UNLESS THAT CONTACT IS APPROVED BY THE BUREAU OF MILWAUKEE CHILD WELFARE AND SUPERVISED BY THE BUREAU OF MILWAUKEE CHILD WELFARE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brandy R Terry in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Brandy R Terry in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DALLET, Branch 40.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 40.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
